contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Jhomonsugi_in_Yaku_Island_Japan_001.JPG|right|thumb|[[Jōmon Sugi]] in Yaku Island Japan]] {{nihongo|'''Yaku'''|屋久町|Yaku-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located on the southern half of [[Yakushima]] (Yaku Island) in [[Kumage District, Kagoshima|Kumage District]], [[Kagoshima Prefecture|Kagoshima]], [[Japan]]. On October 1, 2007 Yaku was merged with the town of [[Kamiyaku, Kagoshima|Kamiyaku]], also from [[Kumage District, Kagoshima|Kumage District]], to form the new town of [[Yakushima, Kagoshima|Yakushima]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 7,008 and a [[population density]] of 28.96 persons per km². The total area was 242.03 km². ==External links== *{{ja icon}}{{iawm|http://www3.synapse.ne.jp/yaku/|Yaku Town}} *{{en icon}}{{iawm|http://www3.synapse.ne.jp/yaku/for_english/top_page.htm|Yaku Town}} *{{ja icon}}[http://www.yakushima-town.jp/ Yakushima Town] [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Kagoshima Prefecture]] {{coord|30|16|48|N|130|34|38|E|region:JP_type:city|display=title}} {{Kagoshima-geo-stub}}
